## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I'm trying to get some information about a Verus blockchain. Can you tell me what kind of information I can get about the current state of a Verus blockchain from the consensus API endpoint?

**AI Assistant:**
The consensus API endpoint provides a wide range of information about the current state of a Verus blockchain. This includes the current network name, blockchain ID, number of blocks processed, number of headers validated, best block hash, difficulty, verification progress, total amount of work in the active chain, total amount of stake in the active chain, whether the local chain is pruned, estimated size of block and undo files on disk, number of note commitments in the commitment tree, and status of value pools and softforks. That's a lot of info!

**User:**
That's great! There's a lot of info there. I'm particularly interested in the "chain" field. What's the purpose of that field in the consensus API endpoint response?

**AI Assistant:**
The "chain" field in the consensus API endpoint response indicates the current network name as defined in BIP70, which can be "main", "test", or "regtest". So, it tells you which network you're on.

**User:**
Got it. Another field I'm not sure about is "verificationprogress". What does that field represent?

**AI Assistant:**
The "verificationprogress" field in the consensus API endpoint response represents an estimate of the verification progress of the blockchain, with a value between 0 and 1. So, it gives you an idea of how far along the blockchain is in terms of verification.

**User:**
That makes sense. What about the "chainwork" field? What's that all about?

**AI Assistant:**
The "chainwork" field in the consensus API endpoint response represents the total amount of work in the active chain, and it is represented as a hexadecimal string. That's a measure of the total work done on the blockchain so far.

**User:**
I'm also interested in value pools. What kind of information can I get about value pools from the consensus API endpoint?

**AI Assistant:**
The consensus API endpoint provides information about value pools, including the name of the value pool, whether it is monitored, the total coins in the value pool, and the total satoshis in the value pool. So, you can get a good understanding of the value pool's status and contents.

**User:**
Finally, I'd like to know more about softforks. What kind of information can I get about softforks from the consensus API endpoint?

**AI Assistant:**
The consensus API endpoint provides information about softforks, including the name of the softfork, block version, and progress toward enforcing the softfork. So, you can stay up-to-date on the status of softforks on the blockchain.

What information can I get about the current state of a Verus blockchain from the consensus API endpoint?

The consensus API endpoint provides a wide range of information about the current state of a Verus blockchain. This includes the current network name, blockchain ID, number of blocks processed, number of headers validated, best block hash, difficulty, verification progress, total amount of work in the active chain, total amount of stake in the active chain, whether the local chain is pruned, estimated size of block and undo files on disk, number of note commitments in the commitment tree, and status of value pools and softforks.

Note that when the chain tip is at the last block before a network upgrade activation,
consensus.chaintip != consensus.nextblock.#### Result:
```json
{
 "chain": "xxxx",      (string) current network name as defined in BIP70 (main, test, regtest)
 "name": "xxxx",       (string) current network name of blockchain ID (VRSC, VRSCTEST, PBAASNAME)
 "chainid": "xxxx",     (string) blockchain ID (i-address of the native blockchain currency)
 "blocks": xxxxxx,      (numeric) the current number of blocks processed in the server
 "headers": xxxxxx,     (numeric) the current number of headers we have validated
 "bestblockhash": "...",   (string) the hash of the currently best block
 "difficulty": xxxxxx,    (numeric) the current difficulty
 "verificationprogress": xxxx, (numeric) estimate of verification progress [0..1]
 "chainwork": "xxxx"     (string) total amount of work in active chain, in hexadecimal
 "chainstake": "xxxx"    (string) total amount of stake in active chain, in hexadecimal
 "pruned": "xx"       (boolean) when true the local chain is pruned
 "size_on_disk": xxxxxx,   (numeric) the estimated size of the block and undo files on disk
 "commitments": xxxxxx,   (numeric) the current number of note commitments in the commitment tree
 "valuePools": [       (array) status of valuepools
  {
   "id": "xxxx",      (string) name of valuepool
   "monitored": xx,    (boolean)
   "chainValue": xxxx,   (numeric) total coins in this valuepool
   "chainValueZat": xxxx, (numeric) total sats in this valuepool
  },
 ],
 "softforks": [        (array) status of softforks in progress
   {
    "id": "xxxx",     (string) name of softfork
    "version": xx,     (numeric) block version
    "enforce": {      (object) progress toward enforcing the softfork
./raw_text_input_wiki/clifaq-02_verus_commands.md
